message.content:
cs.CR, cs.NI, cs.DC, cs.SI, cs.CY 

The paper deals with network-level attacks on Bitcoin, which involves aspects of computer security (cs.CR), computer networks (cs.NI), distributed computing (cs.DC), social and information networks (cs.SI), and cryptography (cs.CY). The paper discusses the centralization of Bitcoin from a routing and mining perspective, which falls under the category of computer networks. The paper also discusses the potential damage to Bitcoin, which falls under the category of computer security. The paper also discusses the feasibility of large-scale attacks, which falls under the category of distributed computing. The paper also discusses the impact of network-level attacks on revenue, which falls under the category of social and information networks. Finally, the paper discusses approaches to mitigate such attacks, which falls under the category of cryptography.
